column1: Topic title: Wee Ka Siong  MCA helping Small And Medium sized

column8: MCA is helping small and medium-sized entrepreneurs (SMEs) achieve their full potential, deputy president Datuk Seri Dr Wee Ka Siong says.He said Koperasi Jayadiri Malaysia (Kojadi) had disbursed RM89.08mil in loans to SME applicants nationwide.“So far, 477 SMEs have been offered loans and Johor ranks the second highest,” he said after attending a dialogue session with SMEs here yesterday.The event was held in conjunction with MCA Teguh Bersama carnival at the district.Applicants, aged between 21 and 60, who need funds for their business would be considered for loans of between RM50,000 and RM250,000.Successful applicants would be allowed up to five years to repay the loan at a flat interest rate of 4% a year.Dr Wee, who is also Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department, said MCA would continue to engage SMEs through dialogues to help them.He advised SMEs to adapt to the ever changing economy and use modern technology to advance their business.“The future is digital economy. They must be brave in changing their mindset to adapt to it,” he addedAt the dialogue, Dr Wee said that many SMEs had voiced their concern on their inability to hire foreign workers.“Muar is well known for its manufacturing sector, especially in the furnishing industry where they export their products to 160 countries.“They have paid the levy but the foreign workers have yet to arrive. I will forward their complaints to the relevant authorities,” he said.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...q3MrqSG4thZT.99
